page.title: 08IDSWORTH (CONT)
page.content:
{St.Hubert's Chapel }
St.Hubert's Chapel is half a mile from the original site of Idsworth House. Originally it was dedicated to St. Peter and St. Paul in 1053 A.D. It was then named after St.Hubert the patron saint of hunters,son of the Duke of Aquitaine,who died in 727. The first recorded Rector was Philip de Hamiltone in 1305. There have been about 51 rectors since, including John Audley 1646 to 1660 noted as "intruder". Inside the chapel are items of interest_a Norman window, a 600 year old font,a 17th century pulpit,ancient murals about 700 years old and 13 attractive plaster casts over the altar.
